**EZ899-230120/A: Immigration Holding Centre (IHC) Main Perimeter Gates Replacement**
====================================================


### **Tender Announcement Overview**

The Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) invites bidders to submit proposals for the Immigration Holding Centre (IHC) Main Perimeter Gates Replacement project in Surrey, British Columbia.


### **Contract Requirements**

*   Demolition and replacement of main perimeter gates
*   Structural foundation and electrical power systems
*   Paving remediation as a result of installation of new gates
*   The work will be carried out in phases to ensure the security of the perimeter is not compromised

The Contractor must perform and complete the Work within 16 weeks from the date of notification of acceptance of the offer.


### **Security Requirements**

*   The Contractor/Offeror must, at all times during the performance of the Contract, hold a valid Facility Security Clearance at the level of RELIABILITY issued by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).
*   Employer personnel requiring access to sensitive sites must EACH hold a valid personnel security screening at the level of RELIABILITY STATUS, as required, granted or approved by the CSP, PWGSC.


### **Tender Procedure**

A two-phase selection process will be used to evaluate proposals.

    *   Phase One:  The qualification of all bidders will be evaluated. Suppliers who wish to submit qualifications for this project should obtain tender documents through [Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders](http://Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders). Addenda, when issued will be available from [Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders](http://Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders).
    *   Phase Two:  Suppliers who have been pre-qualified in Phase One will be invited to submit a financial proposal on the project.

Faxed and hard copy bids will not be accepted for the subject solicitation.


### **Important Notice to Suppliers**

Suppliers must submit their proposals electronically using Canada Post Corporation’s (CPC) Connect application for the subject solicitation. Suppliers who need to use CPC Connect to submit a proposal or obtain additional information can contact the Pacific Region Bid Receiving Unit’s generic address at [TPSGC.RPReceptiondessoumissions-PRBidReceiving.PWGSC@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:TPSGC.RPReceptiondessoumissions-PRBidReceiving.PWGSC@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca )
